TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit JobScheduleOperations extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IInheritedBehaviors

Docs.summary: Performs operations on Azure Batch job schedules.

Docs.summary: Creates an instance of CloudJobSchedule that is unbound and does not have a consistency relationship to any job schedule in the Batch Service.
Docs.returns: A representing a new job schedule that has not been submitted to the Batch service.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> CustomBehaviors { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> CustomBehaviors
Public Property CustomBehaviors As IList(Of BatchClientBehavior)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a list of behaviors that modify or customize requests to the Batch service made via this .

remarks.para: These behaviors are inherited by child objects.
Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DeleteJobSchedule (string jobScheduleId, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = default);

.method public hidebysig instance void DeleteJobSchedule(string jobScheduleId, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors) cil managed

member this.DeleteJobSchedule : string * seq<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> -> unit

Docs.param: The id of the job schedule.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .

remarks.para: The delete operation requests that the job schedule be deleted. The request puts the schedule in the state. The Batch service will delete any existing jobs and tasks under the schedule, including any active job, and perform the actual job schedule deletion without any further client action.
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.param: The id of the job schedule.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
Docs.summary: Disables the specified job schedule. Disabled schedules do not create new jobs, but may be re-enabled later.

remarks.para: This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

Docs.param: The id of the job schedule.
A used for filtering the list and for controlling which properties are retrieved from the service.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the and .
Docs.summary: Enumerates the jobs created under the specified job schedule.
Docs.returns: An that can be used to enumerate jobs asynchronously or synchronously.
Docs.remarks: This method returns immediately; the jobs are retrieved from the Batch service only when the collection is enumerated. Retrieval is non-atomic; jobs are retrieved in pages during enumeration of the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public void TerminateJobSchedule (string jobScheduleId, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = default);

member this.TerminateJobSchedule : string * seq<Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior> -> unit

Docs.param: The id of the job schedule.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .

remarks.para: The terminate operation requests that the job schedule be terminated. The request puts the schedule in the state. The Batch service will wait for any active job to terminate, and perform the actual job schedule termination without any further client action.
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .
